name: propagative
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
for, or relating to, producing young plants or animals : The rules apply to laboratories and greenhouses that provide propagative material used to grow certified seed potatoes. Insects, birds and animals are all implicated in the nutritional cycles, the propagative processes and the sex life of plants.
relating to the spreading of opinions, lies, or beliefs : This "word of mouth" propagative process is an inefficient one because it is a voluntary one.
More examplesFewer examplesSpecies and individuals that attain propagative power late make for progress of the stock.Infected propagative roots have been exposed to heated air and water.Ban living plants and propagative plant parts (e. g. roots and root stock) that are not accompanied by a state Department of Agriculture Certificate of Inspection.
